page.title: 03Bredfield Primary School
page.content: Bredfield Primary School is a small village school with twenty six pupils altogether. There are two full time teachers and one working part-time for a Wednesday morning each week. The school has two classrooms, a Portacabin office, a canteen where the meals are cooked and outbuildings for storage. There are two playgrounds, one in front of the building and one behind, which leads to the village playing field, where the pupils can play. In the summer on the back playground a trainer swimming pool is put up. It is five metres long by two and a half metres wide and is about eighty centimetres deep. If it is warm enough the children swim every day. The Education Authority wishes to close the school in July, 1986, but everyone in the village wants it to stay open.
